pr_title: fix(broker): refactor zeebe partition health monitoring

timeline.bodyText: To organize a little, please place this field next to raftPartitionHealth
timeline.author: korthout

timeline.bodyText: Here I would appreciate that organisation as well.
timeline.author: korthout

timeline.bodyText: I like consistency. So please either create a zeebePartitionName field similar to raftPartitionName, or change raftPartitionName to a getName method as a member of RaftPartitionHealth
timeline.author: korthout

timeline.bodyText: This entire method (i.e. updateHealthStatus) can be inlined, I think that might be better, please just have a look whether that makes sense.
timeline.author: korthout

timeline.bodyText:
It's possible that the health status is updated, but that the failure listener is not made aware of this (because failure listener is still null), should we add a delayed onRecover/onFailure to the moment the failure listener is added?
Of course we also still have the probing part (getHealthStatus), so that part works correctly anyways, but has delay, since its periodically
timeline.author: korthout

replies.bodyText: Also, perhaps we can find a way to remove the duplication between this method, CriticalComponentsHealthMonitor#calculateHealth and ZeebePartition#notifyFailureListenerAndUpdateMetrics?
replies.author: korthout

replies.bodyText:
It's possible that the health status is updated, but that the failure listener is not made aware of this (because failure listener is still null), should we add a delayed onRecover/onFailure to the moment the failure listener is added?

I would like to keep it simple and let it recover in the next probe. Also in this case, we know the failureListener is not null. But the check is added only for safety.
replies.author: deepthidevaki

replies.bodyText:
Also, perhaps we can find a way to remove the duplication between this method, CriticalComponentsHealthMonitor#calculateHealth and ZeebePartition#notifyFailureListenerAndUpdateMetrics?

I removed 'notifyFailureListenerAndUpdateMetrics' and handled these cases directly in  ZeebePartition#onRecovered and onFailure.
replies.author: deepthidevaki
